questions.question_text: Which statement about Enhanced Location-based CAC on a Cisco Unified Communications Manager-based voice network is false?

discussion.content:
CIPTV 2 Book:

-LCAC cannot adjust its knowledge of effective paths due to link failures and reconfigurations (such as newly added links).

choices.B: Each cluster requires a complete view of the modeled topology.
choices.C: E-LCAC can adjust its knowledge of effective paths due to link failures and reconfigurations.
choices.D: Each cluster should be configured with the immediate neighboring locations such that the topology of each cluster can interconnect.
choices.A: Every cluster that participates in LBM requires the location be locally configured for location to device association.

questions.question_text: Which feature enables users to manage business calls by using one phone number to pick up in-progress calls on either their desk phone or their mobile phone?

discussion.content: Correct answer must be D - Mobile Connect

choices.A: DSCP for audio portion of video calls
choices.C: DSCP for audio portion of Cisco TelePresence calls

questions.question_text: Which DSCP service parameter can be configured for Cisco TS endpoints and Cisco Communication Manager endpoints?

comments.content:
No, wait!, I was reviewing an MX300 config, And we have the following defaults values:
Network 1 QoS Diffserv Audio: 46
Network 1 QoS Diffserv Data: 34
Network 1 QoS Diffserv ICMPv6: 0
Network 1 QoS Diffserv NTP: 0
Network 1 QoS Diffserv Signalling: 24
Network 1 QoS Diffserv Video: 34
Network 1 QoS Mode: Diffserv
It means that for audio is taking the DiffServ of a standard Audio Call , and video refers to a Video call (both audio and video components), also, TS endpoints are capable to do standard audio calls. Then Answer B is correct, because audio calls are common in all of the collaboration endpoints. 
Correct answer is B.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
There should be an option that says "all the options mentioned", because all those parameters are literally configurable in Service Parameters, both for TS endpoints and CUCM endpoints. Any idea?
For a more symbolic ideology, since legacy devices were only audio endpoints, I would prefer B. in that assumption. However, it is in base just in a ideology, not in a technical basis, since all of these options are available in service parameters.
C... The answer must be C, if ask about UC endpoint, it would be A.
maybe the correct answer is C.
Sorry, forget the above response. Correct answers C & D.

choices.D: The user device profile is not associated to the correct end user.
choices.C: The Extension Mobility has not been activated under the Cisco Unified Serviceability.
choices.B: Extension Mobility has not been enable under the Enterprise Parameters.
choices.A: The user must ensure that their main endpoint is online and registered, otherwise they cannot log in elsewhere.
choices.E: The username must be numeric only and must match the DN.

questions.question_text:
The administrator at Company X is trying to set up Extension Mobility and has done these steps:
✑ Set up and users accounts for the users who need to roam
✑ Set up a device profile for the type of phones users will be allowed to log in
Users have reported to the administrator that they are unable to log in to the phones designated for Extension Mobility. Which two options are the two reasons for this issue? (Choose two.)
Which two items must you configure in Cisco Unified Communications Manager to deploy Cisco SAF? (Choose two.)
